info.title: Axiom
info.description: A public and stable API for interacting with axiom services

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Optional: Filter for events after this date. Use RFC3339 time format.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Optional: Filter for events before this date. Use RFC3339 time format.

post.description: Delete blocks that have non-zero matches for an APL query.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Start time (ISO 8601 format) for filtering alert history.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: End time (ISO 8601 format) for filtering alert history.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
end time for the query, these must be specified as RFC3339 strings
or using relative time expressions (e.g. now-1h, now-1d, now-1w, etc)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
start time for the query, these must be specified as RFC3339 strings
or using relative time expressions (e.g. now-1h, now-1d, now-1w, etc)

parameters.name: includeCursor
parameters.description:
includeCursor specifies whether the cursor should be included in the results.
This is useful for clients that want to resume a query at a later time. includeCursor is only advised to be set to true when you are resolving a deep-link to a specific row, and never otherwise.
The only thing it controls is that the DB will include the row pointed to be the cursor in the results.
It does not control whether or not cursors are returned. They are always returned (only for time sorted filter-queries).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: OAuth state parameter for CSRF protection

parameters.name: X-Slack-Signature
parameters.description: Slack request signature for verifying the request.

parameters.name: X-Slack-Request-Timestamp
parameters.description: Slack request timestamp for verifying the request.

post.description: Redirect user to Slack for authentication

expiresAt.description: Expiration date of the token (ISO 8601 format)

args.description: Args specifies any non-field arguments for the aggregation. Fx. [10] for topk(players, 10).

fields.description:
Fields specifies the names of the fields this aggregation is computed on.
Fx ["players"] for topk(players, 10)

name.description:
Name is the system name of the aggregation, which is the string form of aggregation.Type.
If the aggregation is aliased, the alias is stored in the parent FieldInfo

AggInfo.description: AggInfo captures information about an aggregation

checkId.description: ID of the check that triggered the alert.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the transition into the current state.

datasets.description: array<string> of dataset names for which the annotation appears on charts

description.description: Explanation of the event the annotation marks on the charts

time.description: Time the annotation marks on the charts. If you don't include this field, Axiom assigns the time of the API request to the annotation.

title.description: Summary of the annotation that appears on the charts

type.description: Type of the event marked by the annotation. Use only alphanumeric characters or hyphens. For example, "production-deployment".

url.description: URL relevant for the event marked by the annotation. For example, link to GitHub pull request.

example.description: Deploy new feature to the sales form
example.title: Production deployment

Modules.description: Modules is an optional set of module names => module sources that will be available to this query

startTime.description:
start and end time for the query, these must be specified as RFC3339 strings
or using relative time expressions (e.g. now-1h, now-1d, now-1w, etc)

variables.description: Variables is an optional set of additional variables that are inserted into the APL

code.description: Status is the http status code associated with this error

column.description: Column is the column associated with this compile type error

compileErrorCode.description:
CompileErrorCode is a special error code that is only available for Compile Errors
It is an integer value that can be used to identify the error

errorType.description: Error Type is an integer value indicating the kind of error

line.description: Line is the line associated with this compile type error

message.description: Message is the raw error message without any formatting

tables.description: Tables hold the result data for a query

BucketInfo.title: BucketInfo captures information about how a grouped query is sorted into buckets.

field.description: Field specifies the field used to create buckets on. Normally this would be _time.

size.description:
An integer or float representing the fixed bucket size.
When the bucket field is _time this value is in nanoseconds.

BucketInfo.description: The standard mode of operation for Kirby is to create buckets on the _time column,

expiresAt.description: Expiration date of the token (ISO 8601 format)

created.description: The RFC3339-formatted time when the dataset was created.

FieldInfo.title: FieldInfo captures information about a field used in the tabular result format. See Table.

GroupInfo.title: GroupInfo captures information about a grouping clause in the tabular result format. See Table.

datasets.description: array<string> of dataset names for which the annotation appears on charts

description.description: Explanation of the event the annotation marks on the charts

time.description: Time the annotation marks on the charts. If you don't include this field, Axiom assigns the time of the API request to the annotation.

title.description: Summary of the annotation that appears on the charts

type.description: Type of the event marked by the annotation. Use only alphanumeric characters or hyphens. For example, "production-deployment".

url.description: URL relevant for the event marked by the annotation. For example, link to GitHub pull request.

RangeInfo.title: RangeInfo specifies the window a query was restricted to.

end.description:
End is the ending time the query is limited by.
Queries are restricted to the interval (start,end).

field.description: Field specifies the field name on which the query range was restricted. Normally _time

start.description:
Start is the starting time the query is limited by.
Queries are restricted to the interval (start,end).

existingTokenExpiresAt.description: Expiration date of the existing token (ISO 8601 format)

newTokenExpiresAt.description: Expiration date of the new token (ISO 8601 format)

api_app_id.description: ID of the Slack app that the event is for

channel.description: Channel ID where the event occurred

ts.description: Timestamp of when the event occurred

user.description: ID of the user who triggered the event

event_time.description: Timestamp of when the event was dispatched

team_id.description: ID of the team where the event originated

token.description: Verification token to validate the event is from Slack

SourceInfo.title: SourceInfo specifies the provenance of a results Table.
SourceInfo.description:
Result sources will typically be the names of a datasets that were searched,
but may be expanded to other things in the future.

maxCursor.description:
Row id of the newest row, as seen server side.
May be higher than what the results include if the server scanned more data than included in the results.
Can be used to efficiently resume time-sorted non-aggregating queries (ie filtering only).

minCursor.description:
Row id of the oldest row, as seen server side.
May be lower than what the results include if the server scanned more data than included in the results.
Can be used to efficiently resume time-sorted non-aggregating queries (ie filtering only).

Table.title: Table defines the schema for query results.

columns.description:
Columns contain a series of arrays with the raw result data.
The columns here line up with the fields in the Fields array.

fields.description:
Fields contain information about the fields included in these results.
The order of the fields match up with the order of the data in Columns.

groups.description: Groups specifies which grouping operations has been performed on the results.

name.description: Name is the name assigned to this table. Defaults to "0". The name "_totals" is reserved for system use.

order.description: Order echoes the ordering clauses that was used to sort the results.

sources.description: Sources contain the names of the datasets that contributed data to these results.

datasets.description: array<string> of dataset names for which the annotation appears on charts

description.description: Explanation of the event the annotation marks on the charts

time.description: Time the annotation marks on the charts. If you don't include this field, Axiom assigns the time of the API request to the annotation.

title.description: Summary of the annotation that appears on the charts

type.description: Type of the event marked by the annotation. Use only alphanumeric characters or hyphens. For example, "production-deployment".

url.description: URL relevant for the event marked by the annotation. For example, link to GitHub pull request.
